articles.headline: U.A.W. Makes Concessions to Help Automakers
articles.snippet: The surprise move by the United Automobile Workers could help the auto industry secure federal aid.
articles.abstract: The surprise move by the United Automobile Workers could help the auto industry secure federal aid.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The United Automobile Workers union said Wednesday that it would make major concessions in its contracts with the three Detroit auto companies to help them lobby Congress for $34 billion in federal aid.

articles.headline: Episcopal Split as Conservatives Form New Group
articles.snippet: Conservatives alienated over the ordination of an openly gay bishop said they would create a rival denomination.
articles.abstract: Conservatives alienated over the ordination of an openly gay bishop said they would create a rival denomination.
articles.lead_paragraph: WHEATON, Ill.  Conservatives alienated from the Episcopal Church announced on Wednesday that they were founding their own rival denomination, the biggest challenge yet to the authority of the Episcopal Church since it ordained an openly gay bishop five years ago.

articles.headline: Motozine ZN5 Makes Pictures Equal to Calls
articles.snippet: The Motorola/Kodak Motozine ZN5 is more of a proper digital camera than almost any phone before it.
articles.abstract: The Motorola/Kodak Motozine ZN5 is more of a proper digital camera than almost any phone before it.
articles.lead_paragraph: All right already  enough with the iPhone wannabes!

articles.headline: Recession Trickles to India
articles.snippet: India is feeling the cutbacks in America and elsewhere, as high-tech companies and outsourcing firms tighten their belts by freezing salaries and laying off workers.
articles.abstract: India is feeling the cutbacks in America and elsewhere, as high-tech companies and outsourcing firms tighten their belts by freezing salaries and laying off workers.
articles.lead_paragraph: BANGALORE, India  After years of being blamed for job losses in America and elsewhere, India’s high-tech companies and outsourcing firms are going through a downturn of their own. The global slowdown is forcing them to reduce hiring, freeze salaries, postpone new investments and lay off thousands of software programmers and call center operators.

articles.headline: A Rush Into Refinancing as Mortgage Rates Fall
articles.snippet: The Treasury’s efforts to jump-start the housing market led to a surge in mortgage refinancing activity, and officials are considering new ways to entice buyers.
articles.abstract: The Treasury’s efforts to jump-start the housing market led to a surge in mortgage refinancing activity, and officials are considering new ways to entice buyers.
articles.lead_paragraph: The housing market may finally be getting some relief, with lower mortgage rates already encouraging refinancing and Treasury officials considering ways to entice new buyers.

articles.headline: Fortress, the Hedge Fund, Is Crumbling
articles.snippet: Shares in the Fortress Investment Group plummeted 25 percent, to $1.87, after the firm said that it had temporarily suspended redemptions at its largest fund.
articles.abstract: Shares in the Fortress Investment Group plummeted 25 percent, to $1.87, after the firm said that it had temporarily suspended redemptions at its largest fund.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Wesley R. Edens and his partners founded their investment firm a decade ago, they chose a name that evoked unshakeable bastions: Fortress.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: With Saturn, G.M. Failed a Makeover
articles.snippet: With sales of Saturn vehicles falling, G.M. said it was “exploring alternatives” for the brand that was once considered a symbol of its future.
articles.abstract: With sales of Saturn vehicles falling, G.M. said it was “exploring alternatives” for the brand that was once considered a symbol of its future.
articles.lead_paragraph: General Motors has promised Congress that it can recreate itself as a different kind of car company  smaller, with a more cooperative relationship with its union, and a lineup of fuel-efficient cars to compete with the best of the foreign brands.

articles.headline: Publishers Announce Staff Cuts
articles.snippet: Random House announced a sweeping reorganization aimed at trimming costs, while Simon & Schuster said it was cutting 35 jobs.
articles.abstract: Random House announced a sweeping reorganization aimed at trimming costs, while Simon & Schuster said it was cutting 35 jobs.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a day of especially grim news for the book business, Random House, the world’s largest publisher of consumer books, announced a sweeping reorganization aimed at trimming costs, while Simon & Schuster laid off 35 people.

articles.headline: Mumbai Attack Is Test for Pakistan on Curbing Militants
articles.snippet: Evidence of links between the attacks and a Pakistani militant group raises the question of whether Pakistan’s government is able — or willing — to rein in militancy.
articles.abstract: Evidence of links between the attacks and a Pakistani militant group raises the question of whether Pakistan’s government is able — or willing — to rein in militancy.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAHORE, Pakistan — Mounting evidence of links between the Mumbai terrorist attacks and a Pakistani militant group is posing the stiffest test so far of Pakistan’s new government, raising questions whether it can — or wants to — rein in militancy here.
articles.byline: By Jane Perlez and Somini Sengupta

articles.headline: Terror Attacks Traced to Two From Pakistan
articles.snippet: The Mumbai police identified a second Pakistani terrorist as an engineer of the attacks, as gruesome new evidence emerged of mistreatment of hostages.
articles.abstract: The Mumbai police identified a second Pakistani terrorist as an engineer of the attacks, as gruesome new evidence emerged of mistreatment of hostages.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Fresh evidence unearthed Thursday by investigators in India indicated that the Mumbai attacks were stage-managed from at least two Pakistani cities by top leaders of the militant group Lashkar-e-Taiba.
articles.byline: By Jane Perlez and Robert F. Worth

articles.headline: Retail Sales Are Weakest in 35 Years
articles.snippet: Most of the nation’s stores kicked-off the critical holiday shopping season with double-digit sales declines, despite relatively strong sales in the few days after Thanksgiving.
articles.abstract: Most of the nation’s stores kicked-off the critical holiday shopping season with double-digit sales declines, despite relatively strong sales in the few days after Thanksgiving.
articles.lead_paragraph: The nation’s retailers turned in the worst sales figures in at least a generation on Thursday, starting the holiday shopping season with double-digit declines across a broad spectrum of stores.

articles.headline: Auto Executives Still Find Skeptics
articles.snippet: Detroit automakers are confronting the harsh politics of a downturn and realizing there might be too few votes to save them.
articles.abstract: Detroit automakers are confronting the harsh politics of a downturn and realizing there might be too few votes to save them.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The chief executives of America’s foundering automobile manufacturers returned to Capitol Hill on Thursday and found themselves confronting years of pent-up anger, the harsh politics of a recession and the realization that even their strongest supporters might not be able to muster the votes to save them.
articles.byline: By David M. Herszenhorn and Bill Vlasic
